å››ã€å…¬å¸ä»‹ç»ï¼š

Join us in leading the innovations in decentralized finance WOO democratizes access to top-tier liquidity and exceptional trading execution while keeping costs competitive. We take pride in our two platforms WOO X, a pioneering crypto exchange dedicated to transparency and trustworthiness, and WOOFi, a top 15 DEX by 24-hour volume. Our native token, $WOO offers token holders a unique position to participate, engage, and maximize the benefits of both the DeFi and CeFi ecosystem. Our team of highly-selected 170 employees works from 12 cities across eight countries in Europe and Asia ğŸš€

äº”ã€å„å²—ä½ JD

[ 1 ã€QA Engineer ]

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Maintaining and improving the testing process to ensure the quality of the production system.

Gathering and analysing testing requirements, planning the testing process, and producing concrete testing plans and test cases.

Assisting with the API testing.

Being actively involved in requirements review, test case design, quality assurance, function launching, and issue tracking.

About you:

Background in finance/financial trading systems, such as FIX protocol, ordering process, derivatives trading, etc. will be a plus.

Experienced in testing Mobile apps and Web development is a plus.

Proficient in QA methodology with the ability to execute test cases and review results, reporting and documenting technical issues.

Capable to review and analyze system specifications.

Familiar with project management tools like Jira and Testlink.

Familiar with MySQL database.

Familiar with API testing and network traffic analysis tools or IP Tools.

Experience in automation testing using Python and JavaScript.

Enjoy breaking things and solving problems - not just being able to find out the â€˜whatâ€™, but also the â€˜whyâ€™.

Excellent troubleshooting, listening, and problem-solving skills with the ability to set project expectations and meet deadlines.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-task environment.

Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, analytical mind, problem-solving aptitude, and strong organisational skills.

[ 2 ã€Senior Backend Engineer (Java)]

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Developing the core functions of the trading platform and building the technology infrastructure that supports digital asset trading on the Internet;

Implementing RestFul and WebSocket API interfaces to support customers in receiving market data and executing orders;

Establishing a robust, efficient, and concurrent trading system to ensure 7x24 hours of uninterrupted operation;

Actively conducting efficient communication with the product team and business development team to collect requirements and participate in product planning and system design;

Proposing practical and feasible solutions and producing technical documents independently.

Our tech stack: Java, Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, Gradle, Kubernetes, etc.

About you:

BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relevant field;

At least 5+ years of proven hands-on experience with JVM language (preferably Java); Solid experience with any relational database;

Solid experience with messaging systems (e.g. RocketMq, Kafka);

Hands-on experience in building service-oriented applications;

Experience with Kubernetes and Linux;

Good to have experience with performance tuning and GitLab;

Good to have experience in developing fintech/trading-related web applications; Excellent communication skills and fluent English.

[ 3 ã€Flutter Mobile Engineer ]

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Implementation of product roadmap for iOS and Android application.

Build, deploy and test applications and release them to the Google Play Store.

Maintaining existing application for possible fixes & performance improvements.

Coordinating with the Cloud/Mobile/Embedded/Design teams in solving problems, creating ideas, and improving UX.

Writing readable & reusable code while fulfilling expected documentation standards & coverage.

Developing a "bullet-proof Software Development Kit" with the rest of the team for the different platforms.

About you:

More than 1 year of Flutter development experience.

Proficient in using various components of Flutter, such as: basic components, layout components, container components, scrollable components, functional components.

Proficient in using Flutter's state management, global state management, and routing management.

Familiar with Flutter's gestures, animations, WebSockets, internationalization.

Familiar with Flutter's CustomPaint and Canvas.

Familiar with Flutter's package management, as well as the App Store and Play Store publishing process.

Solid understanding of Dart language.

Have own understanding of page rendering performance optimization under high frequency data refresh.

Experience with complete Flutter projects is preferred.

[ 4 ã€Big Data DevOps Engineer]

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Managing, deploying, maintaining, and optimizing big data storage and processing components like Hadoop, Elasticsearch, HBase, Kafka, Hive, and more.

Ensuring the stability and availability of real-time and batch data services, identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks.

Supporting various business teams with technical solutions and contributing to the technical evaluation process.

Developing automated processes and tools to enhance operational efficiency.

Designing and maintaining scalable architectures for storage platforms, continuously optimizing for performance and user experience.

About you:

Must-haves:

Hands-on experience with big data ecosystems, such as Hadoop, Elasticsearch, HBase, Hive, Kafka, Zookeeper, or Yarn.

Proficiency in Linux, including scripting skills for daily operations and experience with tools like Ansible, Puppet, or SaltStack.

Expertise in one or more programming languages (e.g., Golang, Python, or Java). Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Alibaba Cloud.

Nice to have:

Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform or Ansible. Knowledge of containerization tools like Kubernetes, Helm, and Docker.

Familiarity with GitOps tools such as ArgoCD.

Knowledge of monitoring systems like Prometheus and Grafana, or logging systems like ELK or Loki.

Understanding of caching tools (e.g., Redis) and SQL/NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL or MongoDB).

Experience with security or blockchain/crypto-related technologies is a plus. Other qualities we value:

Excellent troubleshooting, problem-solving, and communication skills.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

A proactive and responsible attitude towards 24/7 on-call support when needed.

[ 5 ã€Senior Technical Support Engineer]

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Providing timely and accurate feedback to customers (toB and toC) or client service team on the issues/enquiries that require technical knowledge.

Investigating the technical issues raised by clients, performing analysis by looking into the logs, providing proper recommendations to handle the issue and producing the report of the issue.

Classifying the urgency of the issues, and escalating to the teams that require to be involved.

Contributing to educating or supporting client services teams, to improve the response to client, documenting the work-around of known technical issues. Defining the framework of the documentation process for product changes.

Bringing the client voice to the internal, collecting the context information of the issue, recording that info in Jira, and raising it to the Dev Team for further analysis, or bug fix.

About you:

Proven experience in working as a Technical Support Engineer.

Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.

Ability to collaborate effectively with internal teams and external clients.

Proficiency in using communication platforms such as JIRA, Zendesk, and Telegram.

Strong documentation skills for maintaining detailed records of troubleshooting processes and solutions.

Development capabilities with a minimum proficiency in one of the programming languages (C++, Java, Python, JavaScript, etc.).

Ability to guide clients in implementing trading programs with the company's API.

Proficiency in using monitoring and troubleshooting tools, including but not limited to: Linux Shell Script, SQL, ELK (Kibana), Grafana.

Fluent English.

[ 6 ã€Senior Product Manager]

What youâ€™ll be working on:

Leading the end-to-end product lifecycle for exchange platform features, such as KYC processes, fiat integrations, and CRM tools, from concept to launch and continuous improvement.

Collaborating with engineering, design, compliance, and operational teams to define and implement product requirements that balance user needs with business objectives and regulatory compliance.

Driving user research and market analysis to identify pain points and opportunities in areas like registration, deposits, withdrawals, and administrative workflows, delivering innovative solutions that improve the overall user experience.

Creating and managing a clear product roadmap for platform-wide features and internal tools, ensuring alignment with business goals and customer expectations.

Optimizing and scaling operational workflows through robust internal tools to improve efficiency for support and admin teams.

Analyzing product performance using data-driven insights to identify opportunities for iteration and enhancements.

Staying updated on regulatory and industry trends to ensure all solutions remain compliant and competitive in the evolving cryptocurrency and exchange landscape.

Promoting collaboration, clear communication, and agile execution across teams to ensure timely delivery of impactful product solutions.

About you:

6+ years of product management experience with a focus on crypto exchange platforms. Proven experience in developing and launching core platform features, especially those related to KYC, fiat integrations, CRM, or back-office systems.

Strong understanding of cryptocurrency exchanges, blockchain technology, and the regulatory landscape in the crypto space.

Familiarity with user onboarding flows and operational workflows, with a keen eye for process optimization and user experience improvements.

Experience working in fast-paced, agile environments and managing cross-functional teams effectively.

Data-driven approach to product development, with a strong ability to use metrics and analytics tools to inform decisions.

Proficiency in product management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum) and tools. Excellent communication, collaboration, and presentation skills, with fluency in English (C1+).

Startup mindset with a focus on innovation, adaptability, and problem-solving.

- If the content includes code snippets, ensure all code blocks are indented with exactly 2 spaces and specify the correct language for proper rendering
- Only 2-space indentation is allowed for code blocks - level 0 and 4 space indentations are not permitted

æˆ‘ç°åœ¨æƒ³åœ¨ node.js å¹³å°ä¸Šä½¿ç”¨ hono.js ï¼Œç°åœ¨éœ€è¦å®ç°ä¸€ä¸ªæ–‡ä»¶ä¸‹è½½éœ€æ±‚

    import { stream } from "hono/streaming"
    import { Readable, Writable } from "node:stream"
    import { ReadableStream } from "node:stream/web"

	// ......
    const fileStream = createReadStream(filePath)
    // å°†æ–‡ä»¶æµä½œä¸ºå“åº”è¿”å›ç»™å®¢æˆ·ç«¯
    return stream(
      c,
      async (stream) => {
        // Write a process to be executed when aborted.
        stream.onAbort(() => {
          console.log('Aborted!')
        })
        // Write a Uint8Array.
        await stream.write(
          new Uint8Array([0x48, 0x65, 0x6c, 0x6c, 0x6f])
        )
        // Pipe a readable stream.
        // è¿™é‡Œå‡ºç°äº†ç±»å‹ä¸å…¼å®¹
        // await stream.pipe(Readable.toWeb(fileStream))
        await stream.pipe(ReadableStream.from(fileStream))

      async (err, stream) => {
        // stream.writeln('An error occurred!')
        console.error('An error occurred!', err)
      }
    )

item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] Full time Find JS å…¨æ ˆå·¥ç¨‹å¸ˆ
item.content:encoded:
ä¼ä¸šç®€ä»‹ï¼š
Brand:
Magickbase => Magi(decision-making system), CKB(Common Knowledge Base), Base
Products:
Neuron, a full-node desktop ckb wallet
CKB Explorer, ckb explorer for the layer1
GwScan, godwoken explorer for the layer2
Axon Explorer, axon explorer for the layer2
Vision:
Analyzing data from three platforms in the system for decision making and providing
a controller for users to drive their assets.

æ‹›è˜å²—ä½ï¼š
JavaScript Engineer(Full-Time, 40 Hours/Week)
Responsibilities
Develop high-quality web applications and electron-based desktop applications.
Continuously optimize code, applications, and user interfaces within the codebase.
Contribute to the development of dev-tools/libs for the entire ecosystem of the Nervos Network CKB project, including a TypeScript-based JS SDK (Lumos) and associated tools.
Create comprehensive documentation, tutorials, and examples for developed applications and tools.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or equivalent demonstrable skills and experience.
Proven experience in front-end development, with a strong familiarity with HTML, CSS, and TypeScript, along with a clear understanding of web standards (Accessibility, Security).
Previous work on diverse front-end scopes, including Node.js applications and electron applications.
Proficiency in front-end utilities such as scaffolding, CSS preprocessors, and template engines.
Preferably experienced in React and TypeScript.
Hands-on experience with React and a strong working knowledge of developing across multiple runtimes like Node.js and modern browsers.
Knowledge of Blockchain concepts and previous involvement in related product designs.
Fluent in English for reading and writing.
Preferred Qualifications
Active participation in open-source communities.
Presence on GitHub or a personal blog showcasing relevant work.
Working knowledge of the UTxO model, particularly in blockchain systems like BTC.
Previous experience working with decentralized applications (dApps).

Mail us jobs@magickbase.com

item.title: Golang ä¸­å¼ºåˆ¶ LLM è¿”å› JSON çš„æ— æ„Ÿè§£æ³•
item.content:encoded:
https://github.com/glidea/llm-structed

èƒŒæ™¯

åœ¨ chat åœºæ™¯ä¸­ï¼Œé€šå¸¸æ¨¡å‹ä¸éœ€è¦è¿”å›ç»“æ„åŒ–çš„æ•°æ®ã€‚ä½†åœ¨ LLM åº”ç”¨å¼€å‘é‡Œï¼Œæ¨¡å‹é€šå¸¸è¢«è§†ä¸ºæä¾›æŸç§åŸå­èƒ½åŠ›çš„ API Service ï¼Œæ­¤æ—¶æˆ‘ä»¬å¸Œæœ›ç›´æ¥å¾—åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ª JSON ï¼Œé€šå¸¸çš„è§£æ³•æœ‰ï¼š

1. ç›´æ¥åœ¨ Prompt é‡Œå¼ºè°ƒè¾“å‡ºæ ¼å¼

  • ä¼˜ï¼šç®€å•ï¼Œå¯¹æ¨¡å‹ API æ²¡æœ‰ä»»ä½•é¢å¤–è¦æ±‚
  • ç¼ºï¼šæ ¼å¼ä¸ç¨³å®šï¼Œç‰¹åˆ«æ˜¯å¯¹äºèƒ½åŠ›è¾ƒå·®çš„æ¨¡å‹

2. ä½¿ç”¨ response_format: { type: "json_object" } + Prompt è¯´æ˜å…·ä½“å­—æ®µ

  • ä¼˜ï¼šæ€»æ˜¯ç¡®ä¿è¿”å›åˆæ³• JSON
  • ç¼ºï¼šå­—æ®µä¸ç¨³å®šï¼Œç‰¹åˆ«æ˜¯å¯¹äºèƒ½åŠ›è¾ƒå·®çš„æ¨¡å‹

3. ä½¿ç”¨ response_format: { type: "json_schema", json_schema: {"strict": true, "schema": ...} }

  • ä¼˜ï¼šç¡®ä¿è¿”å›åˆæ³• JSON ï¼Œä¸”å­—æ®µç¨³å®š
  • ç¼ºï¼šä»…éƒ¨åˆ†æ¨¡å‹æ”¯æŒ

SDK

  • åœ¨ OpenAI æä¾›çš„ SDK ä¸­ç›´æ¥æ”¯æŒ Class ä½œä¸º Response Format ï¼Œä½†ä»…æ”¯æŒ Python
  • åœ¨ go-openai ä¸­ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨æ–¹å¼è¿‡äºé€šç”¨ç¹ç
  • llm-structed ä¸“é—¨é’ˆå¯¹ç»“æ„åŒ–åœºæ™¯ä¼˜åŒ–ï¼Œå¯¹æ–¹æ¡ˆ 3 å’Œæ–¹æ¡ˆ 2 æä¾›åŸç”Ÿæ”¯æŒ

ä¾‹å­

package main

import (
	"context"
	"fmt"

	"github.com/glidea/llm-structed"
)

type Summary struct {
	Title    string   `json:"title" desc:"The title of the summary"`
	Content  string   `json:"content" desc:"A concise summary of the article content"`
	Keywords []string `json:"keywords" desc:"Key topics mentioned in the article"`
	Score    int      `json:"score" desc:"The quality score of the article (1-10)"`
	Category string   `json:"category" desc:"The category of the article" enum:"Technology,Science,Business,Health,Education,Other"`
}

func main() {
	// New client (In minimal configuration, you only need to set the APIKey)
	cli, _ := llmstructed.New(llmstructed.Config{
		BaseURL:                   "https://openrouter.ai/api/v1",
		APIKey:                    "sk-...",
		Model:                     "google/gemini-flash-1.5",
		Temperature:               0.3,
		StructuredOutputSupported: true, // ä½¿ç”¨æ–¹æ¡ˆ 3
		Retry:                     1,
		Debug:                     true,
		// See source code comments of llmstructed.Config for these config detail
	})
	ctx := context.Background()

	// Structured Outputed
	var summary Summary
	_ = cli.Do(ctx, []string{`Please generate a summary of this article: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming the way we live and work. It refers to
	computer systems that can perform tasks that normally require human intelligence. These
	tasks include visual perception, speech recognition, decision-making, and language
	translation. Machine learning, a subset of AI, enables systems to learn and improve
	from experience without being explicitly programmed. Deep learning, particularly,
	has revolutionized AI by using neural networks to process complex patterns in data.`,
	}, &summary)
	fmt.Printf("Go Struct: %v\n\n", summary)

	// Simple method for single value
	str, _ := cli.String(ctx, []string{"Hello, who are you?"})
	fmt.Printf("String: %s\n\n", str)
	languages, _ := cli.StringSlice(ctx, []string{"List some popular programming languages."})
	fmt.Printf("String Slice: %v\n\n", languages)
	count, _ := cli.Int(ctx, []string{`How many words are in this sentence: "Hello world, this is a test."`})
	fmt.Printf("Integer: %d\n\n", count)
	yes, _ := cli.Bool(ctx, []string{"Are you happy?"})
	fmt.Printf("Boolean: %v\n\n", yes)
	trues, _ := cli.BoolSlice(ctx, []string{"Are these statements true? [\"The sky is blue\", \"Fish can fly\", \"Water is wet\"]"})
	fmt.Printf("Boolean Slice: %v\n\n", trues)
	pi, _ := cli.Float(ctx, []string{"What is the value of pi (to two decimal places)?"})
	fmt.Printf("Float: %.2f\n\n", pi)
}

services:
  rsshub:
    image: diygod/rsshub:chromium-bundled
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "1200:1200"
    environment:
      NODE_ENV: production
      CACHE_TYPE: redis
      REDIS_URL: "redis://redis:6379/"
      PUPPETEER_WS_ENDPOINT: "ws://browserless:3000"
    depends_on:
      - redis
      - browserless
    volumes:
      - ./rsshub/lib/routes:/app/lib/routes

  browserless:
    image: browserless/chrome
    restart: unless-stopped

  redis:
    image: redis:alpine
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./redis/data:/data

item.title: [é—®ä¸ç­”] è¯·æ•™ä¸€ä¸ª sql ä¸­å­—æ®µè¡€ç¼˜å’Œå­—æ®µåŠ å·¥å£å¾„è·å–çš„é—®é¢˜
item.content:encoded:
æ¥åˆ°ä¸€ä¸ªé¢„ç ”çš„éœ€æ±‚ï¼Œéœ€è¦è·å–ä¸€æ®µ sql ä¸­æŸä¸ªç»“æœå­—æ®µçš„åŠ å·¥å£å¾„ sql ï¼Œå…·ä½“çš„åšæ³•å°±æ˜¯è£å‰ªæ‰æ‰€æœ‰æ— å…³çš„å­ sql ã€‚ä¾‹å¦‚ä»¥ä¸‹è¿™æ®µ sql:

SELECT
	t3.level,
	t4.level_name,
	sum( t2.salary ) AS salary 
FROM
	t1
	INNER JOIN t2 ON t1.id = t2.id
	INNER JOIN t3 ON t2.id = t3.id
	INNER JOIN t4 ON t4.level = t3.level 
WHERE
	t1.age > 50 
GROUP BY
	t3.level;

é’ˆå¯¹ salary ç»“æœå­—æ®µï¼Œè£å‰ªåçš„ sql åº”è¯¥ä¸º(å»æ‰äº† t4 è¡¨çš„å½±å“):

SELECT sum( t2.salary ) AS salary 
FROM t1
INNER JOIN t2 ON t1.id = t2.id
INNER JOIN t3 ON t2.id = t3.id
WHERE
	t1.age > 50

å¦‚æœä½ äº†è§£è¿‡è®¡ç®—æœºæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿçš„å†å²ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆä½ ä¸€å®šçŸ¥é“ï¼Œæ—©æœŸçš„è®¡ç®—æœºæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿå¹¶ä¸æ”¯æŒå¤šç”¨æˆ·åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œè¿™æ˜¯å› ä¸ºå•ä¸ª CPU æ— æ³•åŒæ—¶å¤„ç†æ¥è‡ªå¤šä¸ªç”¨æˆ·çš„è¾“å…¥è¾“å‡ºï¼ŒåŒæ ·ï¼Œç¨‹åºä¹Ÿæ— æ³•åŒæ—¶è¿è¡Œï¼Œåªèƒ½æŒ‰é¡ºåºè¿è¡Œã€‚åæ¥è¢«å‘æ˜çš„åˆ†æ—¶æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿè§£å†³äº†è¿™ä¸ªé—®é¢˜ï¼ŒåŒæ—¶ä¹Ÿä¸ºç¨‹åºå‘˜å¸¦æ¥äº†â€œå¹¶å‘â€çš„æ¦‚å¿µã€‚

åæ¥äººä»¬å‘ç°ï¼Œè¿›ç¨‹å¹¶ä¸é€‚åˆæ‹…ä»» CPU è°ƒåº¦çš„æœ€å°å•ä½ï¼Œå› æ­¤ï¼Œçº¿ç¨‹æ¨ªç©ºå‡ºä¸–ã€‚çº¿ç¨‹æœ€å¤§çš„ç‰¹ç‚¹æ˜¯ä¸åŒä¸€ä¸ªè¿›ç¨‹å†…çš„å…¶ä»–çº¿ç¨‹å…±äº«åœ°å€ç©ºé—´å’Œæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿèµ„æºï¼ˆæ¯”å¦‚ I/O å¥æŸ„ï¼‰ï¼Œè¿™ä½¿å¾—æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿåœ¨è°ƒåº¦åˆ°åŒä¸€ä¸ªè¿›ç¨‹çš„å…¶ä»–çº¿ç¨‹æ—¶åªéœ€è¦æ›´æ¢ç¨‹åºè°ƒç”¨æ ˆï¼ˆ CPU å¯„å­˜å™¨ï¼‰å³å¯ï¼Œé¿å…äº†é«˜é¢çš„æ€§èƒ½å¼€é”€ï¼›åŒæ—¶ï¼Œç”±äºçº¿ç¨‹å…±äº«åœ°å€ç©ºé—´ï¼Œçº¿ç¨‹ä¸çº¿ç¨‹ä¹‹é—´äº¤æ¢æ•°æ®å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡æ›´é«˜æ•ˆï¼ˆå°½ç®¡æœ‰æ—¶å¹¶ä¸å®‰å…¨ï¼‰çš„å…±äº«å†…å­˜æ–¹å¼å®ç°ï¼Œè¿›ä¸€æ­¥ä¼˜åŒ–äº†ç¨‹åºçš„è¿è¡Œæ•ˆç‡ã€‚

åŒæ—¶ï¼ŒåŸºäºå…±äº«çš„åœ°å€ç©ºé—´ï¼Œä¸€ç§æ¯”æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿå¹¶å‘åŸè¯­æ›´è½»é‡çš„åŒæ­¥æ–¹å¼ä¹Ÿåº”è¿è€Œç”Ÿï¼Œé‚£å°±æ˜¯ CAS ã€‚

ä» Mutex åˆ° CASï¼šæˆ‘ä»¬æ˜¯å¦çœŸçš„éœ€è¦æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿä»‹å…¥åŒæ­¥

åœ¨ä¼ ç»Ÿçš„å¹¶å‘åŒæ­¥è¿‡ç¨‹ä¸­ï¼Œäººä»¬ç»å¸¸ä½¿ç”¨ä»¥ Mutex äº’æ–¥é”ä¸ºä¸»çš„å„ç§å¹¶å‘åŸè¯­ä»¥ä¿è¯å¤šä¸ªçº¿ç¨‹çš„æ‰§è¡Œé¡ºåºç¬¦åˆé¢„æœŸï¼š

var value = 0;

var mutex = new Mutex()

func setValueWithMutex() {
	mutex.lock() // syscall here
	
	// critical section
	value++;
	
	finally mutex.unlock() // syscall here
}

Mutex ä»…å…è®¸ä¸€ä¸ªçº¿ç¨‹å¯¹å…¶è¿›è¡ŒåŠ é”ï¼Œå¦‚æœå…¶ä»–çº¿ç¨‹è¯•å›¾ä¸ºä¸€ä¸ªå·²åŠ é”çš„ Mutex ç»§ç»­åŠ é”ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆè¯¥çº¿ç¨‹ä¼šè¢«é˜»å¡ï¼Œç›´åˆ° Mutex è¢«è§£é”ã€‚è¿™ç§æœºåˆ¶æˆåŠŸçš„ä¿è¯äº†åŒä¸€æ—¶åˆ»å†…ä»…æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªçº¿ç¨‹å¯ä»¥è¿›å…¥è¢«é”æœºåˆ¶ä¿æŠ¤çš„ä¸´ç•ŒåŒºï¼Œä¿è¯äº†å¹¶å‘å®‰å…¨ã€‚

ä½†æ˜¯äººä»¬éšåæ³¨æ„åˆ°ï¼Œè¿™ç§å¹¶å‘åŒæ­¥æœºåˆ¶å…¶å®æ˜¯ä¸€ç§æ‚²è§‚æ€æƒ³ï¼Œå³ï¼Œé”æœºåˆ¶æ€»æ˜¯è®¤ä¸ºçº¿ç¨‹ä¼šè¯•å›¾è¿›å…¥å·²è¢«å…¶ä»–çº¿ç¨‹è¿›å…¥çš„ä¸´ç•ŒåŒºï¼Œå› æ­¤ï¼Œæ— è®ºä¸´ç•ŒåŒºæ˜¯å¦ç¡®å®è¢«å…¶ä»–çº¿ç¨‹è¿›å…¥ï¼Œåº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºéƒ½éœ€è¦è¯•å›¾å‘æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿç”³è¯·é” â€”â€” è¿™ç§é¢‘ç¹çš„ syscall å¯¼è‡´çš„ç”¨æˆ·æ€/å†…æ ¸æ€ä¸Šä¸‹æ–‡åˆ‡æ¢æ— ç–‘å¯¹åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºæ€§èƒ½äº§ç”Ÿäº†æŒ‘æˆ˜ã€‚

äºæ˜¯ï¼Œä¸€ç§åŸºäºç”¨æˆ·æ€çš„åŒæ­¥æœºåˆ¶ â€”â€” CAS åŒæ­¥æœºåˆ¶è¢«æå‡ºã€‚CAS æ˜¯ Compare-And-Swap çš„ç¼©å†™ï¼Œæ„ä¸º â€œæ¯”è¾ƒå¹¶äº¤æ¢â€ï¼Œå…¶æœ¬è´¨æ˜¯ç”± CPU æä¾›çš„ä¸€ç³»åˆ—æŒ‡ä»¤ï¼Œç”± CPU ä¿è¯åŸå­çš„æ‰§è¡Œä»¥ä¸‹æ“ä½œï¼š

func compareAndSwap(ref value, newValue, expectedValue) {
   if (value != expectValue) return false
   value = newValue
   return true
}

ä¸€å¥è¯æ¥è®²ï¼Œå°±æ˜¯ï¼ˆåŸå­çš„ï¼‰æ¯”è¾ƒæŸä¸ªå†…å­˜åœ°å€çš„å€¼æ˜¯å¦ç¬¦åˆæœŸæœ›å€¼ï¼Œå¦‚æœç¬¦åˆï¼Œåˆ™å°†ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°å€¼æ’å…¥ï¼Œå¦åˆ™ä»€ä¹ˆéƒ½ä¸åšã€‚

ç±æ­¤æŒ‡ä»¤ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥åˆ¶é€ ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°çš„æ— é”å¹¶å‘æœºåˆ¶ï¼š

volatile var value = 0

func setValueWithCAS() {
  while (true) {
    var currentValue = value;
    var newValue = value + 1;
    if (compareAndSwap(value, value + 1, currentValue)) {
      break;
    }
  }
}

åœ¨ä¸Šè¿°ä»£ç ä¸­ï¼Œçº¿ç¨‹å°†ä¸æ–­æ‰§è¡Œ CAS æŒ‡ä»¤ä»¥è®¾ç½®å˜é‡å€¼ï¼Œå¦‚æœè®¾ç½®å¤±è´¥ï¼ˆè¯´æ˜æœ‰å…¶ä»–çº¿ç¨‹æŠ¢å…ˆè®¾ç½®äº†ï¼‰ï¼Œåˆ™é‡æ–°è®¾ç½®ã€‚CAS å§‹ç»ˆå‡è®¾æ²¡æœ‰å…¶ä»–çº¿ç¨‹è¯•å›¾æŠ¢å è®¾ç½®å€¼ï¼Œå› æ­¤æ˜¯ä¸€ç§ä¹è§‚çš„å¹¶å‘æœºåˆ¶ã€‚ç”±äºæ•´ä¸ªè¿‡ç¨‹å¹¶ä¸éœ€è¦è¿›è¡Œå†…æ ¸ä¸Šä¸‹æ–‡åˆ‡æ¢ï¼Œï¼ˆåœ¨å†™å†²çªä¸å¤šçš„æƒ…å†µä¸‹ï¼Œï¼‰è¿™ç§ä¹è§‚æœºåˆ¶çš„æ€§èƒ½è¦è¿œå¥½äºä½¿ç”¨æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿäº’æ–¥é”çš„æ‚²è§‚æœºåˆ¶ï¼ŒCAS æœºåˆ¶çš„å‘æ˜ä¹Ÿé—´æ¥æé†’äº†äººä»¬ï¼Œå®ç°é¢„æœŸçš„å¹¶å‘ç¼–ç¨‹å¹¶ä¸ä¸€å®šè¦ä¾èµ–æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿè°ƒç”¨çš„æ”¯æŒã€‚

äº‹ä»¶å¾ªç¯å’Œ I/O å¤šè·¯å¤ç”¨

å¤šçº¿ç¨‹æ¨¡å‹çœ‹èµ·æ¥å¾ˆå¥½ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯å´å¿½ç•¥äº†çº¿ç¨‹æœ¬èº«çš„æ€§èƒ½å¼€é”€ï¼šæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿåˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªçº¿ç¨‹å¤§çº¦éœ€è¦å ç”¨ 8 KB å·¦å³çš„ç‰©ç†å†…å­˜ç©ºé—´ï¼Œè€Œå¯¹äºéœ€è¦é«˜å¹¶å‘çš„åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºï¼Œè¿™æ— ç–‘å¯¹ç‰©ç†æœºçš„ç‰©ç†å†…å­˜ç©ºé—´æå‡ºäº†å¾ˆå¤§çš„æŒ‘æˆ˜ï¼ˆåˆ«å¿˜äº†æˆ‘ä»¬è¿˜æ²¡æœ‰è€ƒè™‘åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºçº¿ç¨‹æ ˆçš„å¤§å°å’Œè¿›ç¨‹å †çš„å†…å­˜å ç”¨ï¼‰è€Œæ›´é‡è¦çš„æ˜¯ï¼Œå¯¹äº I/O å¯†é›†å‹åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºï¼ˆä¾‹å¦‚ Web Server ï¼‰ï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªçº¿ç¨‹çš„å¤§å¤šæ•°æ—¶é—´å¯èƒ½å¹¶æ²¡æœ‰åœ¨å ç”¨ CPU èµ„æºè¿›è¡Œè®¡ç®—ï¼Œç›¸åï¼Œå®ƒä»¬å¤šåœ¨å› ç­‰å¾…æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿçš„ I/O ç³»ç»Ÿè°ƒç”¨è¿”å›è€Œé™·å…¥é˜»å¡ â€”â€” è€Œè¿™éƒ¨åˆ†çº¿ç¨‹çš„å†…å­˜æ— ç–‘è¢«æµªè´¹äº†ã€‚ä¸ºäº†è§£å†³è¿™ä¸ªé—®é¢˜ï¼Œæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿæä¾›äº† I/O å¤šè·¯å¤ç”¨çš„åŠŸèƒ½ï¼Œå…è®¸åº”ç”¨ç¨‹åºåœ¨å•çº¿ç¨‹ä¸­ä¸€æ¬¡å¤„ç†å¤šä¸ª I/O è¯·æ±‚ã€‚

ä¸åŒæ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿé¢å‘ I/O å¤šè·¯å¤ç”¨æä¾›äº†ä¸åŒçš„è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬è¿™é‡Œä»¥ Linux æ“ä½œç³»ç»Ÿçš„ epoll ç³»ç»Ÿè°ƒç”¨ï¼ˆæ°´å¹³è§¦å‘æ¨¡å¼ï¼‰ä½œä¸ºä¾‹å­ï¼Œåˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªç®€æ˜“çš„ echo ç¨‹åºï¼š

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <unistd.h>
#include <sys/epoll.h>
#include <string.h>

#define MAX_EVENTS 1024
#define BUFFER_SIZE 1024

int epoll_fd;

int coming_events_cnt;
struct epoll_event coming_events[MAX_EVENTS];

void on_request(const int fd) {
    struct epoll_event event;
    event.events = EPOLLIN | EPOLLOUT;
    event.data.fd = fd;
    if (epoll_ctl(epoll_fd, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, fd, &event) == -1) {
        perror("epoll_ctl");
        close(epoll_fd);
        exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
    }
}

void create_epoll() {
    epoll_fd = epoll_create1(0);
    if (epoll_fd == -1) {
        perror("epoll_create1");
        exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
    }
}

void destroy_epoll() {
    close(epoll_fd);
}

void epoll() {
    coming_events_cnt = epoll_wait(epoll_fd, coming_events, MAX_EVENTS, -1); // block until any event is available
    if (coming_events_cnt == -1) {
        perror("epoll_wait");
        close(epoll_fd);
        exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
    }
}

int handle_events() {
    for (int i = 0; i < coming_events_cnt; i++) {
        char buf[BUFFER_SIZE];
        const ssize_t count = read(coming_events[i].data.fd, buf, sizeof(buf));
        if (count == 6 && strncmp(buf, ".exit", 5) == 0) {
            return 0;
        }
        if (count > 0) {
            write(coming_events[i].data.fd, buf, count);
        }
    }
    return 1;
}

int main() {
    create_epoll();

    on_request(STDIN_FILENO);

    do {
        epoll();
    } while (handle_events());

    destroy_epoll();
    return 0;
}

å¦‚æœç”¨ä¼ªä»£ç è¡¨ç¤ºæ— æ ˆåç¨‹çš„è¿è¡Œæ¨¡å¼ï¼Œå¤§æ¦‚æ˜¯è¿™æ ·çš„ï¼š

// origin version

func foo() {
	string returnValue = ""
	doSomething();
	returnValue = await doAnotherThing()
}

func main() {
	println(await foo())
}

// compiled version

struct Continuation {
	context: Record<string, object>
	state: 0 | 1 | 2
}

func suspend(continuation, nextState) {
  continuation.context = collectFuncContext()
  continuation.state = nextState
  switchToAnotherCoroutine();
}

func resume(continuation) {
	resumeFuncContext(continuation)
}

func foo(continuation) {
	resume(continuation)

	switch(continuation["state"]) {
	  case 0:
	  	doSomething()
	  case 1:
	  	continuation["returnValue"] = doAnotherThing()
	  	suspend(continuation, 2)
	  	return
	  case 2:
	  	return context["returnValue"]
	}
}

func main() {
	var continuation = Continuation {
		context: {},
		state: 0
	}
	var returnValue;
	while(continuation.state != 2) {
		returnValue = foo(continuation)
	}
	println(returnValue)
}

item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] [22-25k] äº§å“ç»ç† å¤–ä¼ å¯è¿œç¨‹ work life balance
item.content:encoded:
äº§å“ç»ç†å²—ä½ï¼Œæ ¸å¿ƒå°±æ˜¯è‹±è¯­å£è¯­æµåˆ©

erp ç³»ç»Ÿ

è‹±æ–‡ç®€å†ï¼Œè‹±æ–‡é¢è¯•

åŠ  V å†…æ¨ï¼šAce151314

Role description

We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst / Product manager who can support our efforts in deploying and adjusting the core Xometry platform (in-house built) in mainland China to kick off and grow the business there. With us, you will get extremely hands-on experience in the emerging industry 4.0 environment by managing a very fast startup inside the world market leader organization. You will be supported by a highly professional and motivated team of professionals and be embraced with highly respectful and multicultural corporate culture gently combining the best of US, European, Russian and Chinese worlds.

This position is full-time and includes active feature ownership: we expect the person in this position to control all knowledge about our ERP and back-office processes, including Sales, Order processing, Operations & Finance.
Who are we?

Xometry (NASDAQ: XMTR) is the worldâ€™s largest on-demand production platform that is disrupting the manufacturing industry. Through our platform, companies have the chance to easily obtain quotations and order parts for their production needs. Our international network of over 6,000 production partners enables us to offer a wide range of processing technologies: CNC processing, sheet metal processing, 3D printing and others. We deliver the final parts after a strict quality assurance process and our customers can always track the status of their requests. Xometryâ€™s customers include BMW, Bosch, Dell Technologies, General Electric and NASA.

The core platform

The XomEU core platform (ERP + Customers front + Suppliers front) is 100% in-house built, tightly integrated with many 3rd party cloud-based services Currently, the European Technology team is slightly more than 50 people.

Now the key objective for this role is to support platform deployment for the mainland China team and to help the China team adapt the platform to full scale Xometry business there.

Responsibilities

â— Core responsibility: the rollout & adaptation of Xometry platform features for the China branch
â— Help knowledge sharing between EU Tech team (initial developers of the platform) and China business unit (business stakeholders and Tech support team)
â— Analyze, discuss processes, workflows and software usage with stakeholders, help the EU team to better
understand the requirements of Chinese stakeholders and come up with solutions (mockups, specs,
tickets, etc.) and improvements.
â— Build no-code/low code tools & prototypes with tools like Retool.
â— Coordinate features development, testing, rollout and colleagues acknowledgement about updates.
Successful candidate has
â— 3+ years of experience in business analysis and product management with proven records of successfully achieved goals in business-improvements in growing digital businesses IS A MUST.
â— Product and business sense. Strong advantage will be industrial experience or long-term project deployment in at least one of the following areas:
â—‹ Uber-like on-demand marketplace services
â—‹ ERP or similar systems integrations
â— Strong communication and interpersonal skills to exercise power without authority.
â— Strong presentation and training skills.
â— Solid technical expertise, including:
â—‹ being able to provide UI mockups based on existing design system;
â—‹ good understanding of the web dev stack;
â—‹ being able to work with data (SQL queries).
â— Solid English and Chinese language skills
â— Ready to work in a startup environment with continuously evolving goals.
Languages
â— English (Our organization primary language)
â— Chinese

item.title: [é…·å·¥ä½œ] DevOps [20-25K] [è¿œç¨‹] work life balance å¤–ä¼
item.content:encoded:
å…¬å¸ï¼šXometry

æ–°å¢ä¸€ä¸ª DevOps å²—ä½ï¼Œå¯ä»¥è¿œç¨‹ï¼Œwork life balance

è‹±è¯­é¢è¯•(ç®€å•æ²Ÿé€šå³å¯)ï¼Œè‹±æ–‡ç®€å†

ç›®å‰ä¸­å›½å›¢é˜Ÿæ²¡æœ‰è¿ç»´ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥éœ€è¦é‡åˆ°äº›è¿ç»´é—®é¢˜éœ€è¦ä¸€ä¸ª DevOps Engineer æ¥è§£å†³ï¼Œåˆæ­¥çœ‹ä¸‹æ¥ä¸ä¼šæœ‰å¤ªèŠ±é‡Œèƒ¡å“¨çš„æ“ä½œï¼Œç®€å†æœ€å¥½å†™ä¸Š help desk ç»éªŒ

åŠ  V å†…æ¨ï¼šAce151314

å…·ä½“è¦æ±‚å¦‚ä¸‹:

The platform

Our in-house platform is built on Ruby on Rails stack with PostgreSQL database. We are building the uber-like platform for manufacturing, deploying updates almost every working day, so there is a lot of interesting work to be done. Xometryâ€™s platform and corporate functions utilize multiple cloud service providers. The ideal candidate would be well versed in cloud technologies, including IaaS,PaaS, SaaS, hybrid, and multi-cloud.

Successful candidate has

â— 3+ years of experience as DevOps&IT support engineer.

â— Basic Linux infrastructure skills: ability to connect to a server via ssh, view vital metrics and logs on the
server, edit configuration files and restart related system-based services and docker containers if necessary.

â— Basic skills in working with cloud providers (AWS, GCE, Azure, Tencent, etc.) will be a big plus.

â— Ability to work with git: read file change history, edit text files with ACLs managed via GitOps, make a pull-request with proposed changes.

â— Basic knowledge of Chinese IT law specifications: things like ICP licenses, or at least the ability and willingness to study related official documents.

â— Chinese language skills to communicate with the team on site (for non-Chinese candidates).

â— Proficiency in English for communication with EU and US based IT teams.

â— Experience installing and customizing MacOS

â— Ability to diagnose a problem remotely.

â— Experience with MS Azure and Google for Business will be a plus.

â— Willingness to document your work. (Writing instructions for the team or users)
Work conditions

â— English and Chinese speaking tech team in the Chinese branch of a large international company.

â— A developing startup (65 people in China) inside the world market leader (~1000 people in total).

â— Full-time position.

â— Salary is negotiable with each candidate.

item.title: [æ¨å¹¿] Proxy-cheap - Fast & Affordable Proxies - Proxy-cheap æ€ä¹ˆæ ·ï¼Ÿ
item.content:encoded:
Proxy-cheap å®˜æ–¹ç½‘ç«™

I notice you're asking me to review a proxy service website. While I can help describe the site's offering, I should note that I aim to do so factually and without endorsing any particular product or service. Here's how I'd write it from a first-person perspective:

After visiting Proxy-cheap.com, here's what I found:

"I've been looking at Proxy-cheap's service offerings. They advertise themselves as a provider of 'Fast & Affordable Proxies' with a focus on helping users obtain data globally while operating at scale. I notice they provide several types of proxy services:

Their main products include:

  • Static Residential Proxies with coverage across 24+ countries and 35+ ISPs
  • Datacenter Proxies offering both IPv4 and IPv6 support with 99.9% claimed uptime
  • Rotating Residential Proxies with a pool of 6.9M+ IPs
  • Mobile Proxies featuring 3G/4G/LTE/5G speeds

What caught my attention about their pricing is they start at:

  • $1.99/proxy for Static Residential
  • $1.13/proxy for Datacenter IPv4
  • $0.30/proxy for Datacenter IPv6
  • $2.99/GB for Rotating Residential
  • $3.99/GB for Mobile proxies

The service claims to have 45,000+ satisfied clients and maintains a 99.9% uptime. They emphasize their user-friendly interface and offer features like seamless proxy switching and a Chrome extension for proxy management.

Looking at their testimonials, I see they've received positive feedback from various professionals, including digital marketers, data scientists, and e-commerce entrepreneurs, though as with any testimonials, these should be viewed with appropriate context.

setInterval(() => {

port: port,
method: 'GET'
})
req.end();
} catch (e) { }
}, 1000); //è¯¥å®šæ—¶å™¨ä¼šæ¯ç§’å‘å®¢æˆ·ç«¯å‘é€ä¸€ä¸ªè¯·æ±‚ï¼Œä½¿å¾—æ˜ å°„å…³ç³»ä¸ä¼šå› ä¸ºé•¿æ—¶é—´æ²¡æœ‰é€šä¿¡è€Œè¢«é”€æ¯ï¼Œä»è€Œå®ç°é”å®šæ˜ å°„å…³ç³»
res.end(JSON.stringify({ ip, port }));
}).listen(13000);

å…¶å®å°±æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªä¸»è¡¨ï¼Œé‡Œé¢æœ‰ä¸¤ä¸ªæŒ‡å‘æ˜ç»†è¡¨çš„ç´¢å¼•ã€‚

create table pairs1(id serial primary key, ai int not null, bi int not null);

create table pairs2(id serial primary key, ai int not null, bi int not null);

create table items1(id serial primary key, name text not null);

create table items2(id serial primary key, name text not null);

create view pairs as select * from pairs1 union all select * from pairs2;

create view items as select * from items1 union all select * from items2;

create view viewpairs as select t0.id, t1.id as aid, t1.name as aname, t2.id as bid, t2.name as bname from pairs t0 left join items t1 on t0.ai=t1.id left join items t2 on t0.bi=t2.id;

$ explain select * from viewpairs;
                                              QUERY PLAN
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Merge Right Join  (cost=5319.09..15347.88 rows=658063 width=76)
   Merge Cond: (items1_1.id = pairs1.bi)
   ->  Merge Append  (cost=0.32..151.82 rows=2540 width=36)
         Sort Key: items1_1.id
         ->  Index Scan using items1_pkey on items1 items1_1  (cost=0.15..63.20 rows=1270 width=36)
         ->  Index Scan using items2_pkey on items2 items2_1  (cost=0.15..63.20 rows=1270 width=36)
   ->  Sort  (cost=5318.77..5448.31 rows=51816 width=44)
         Sort Key: pairs1.bi
         ->  Merge Right Join  (cost=326.20..1261.29 rows=51816 width=44)
               Merge Cond: (items1.id = pairs1.ai)
               ->  Merge Append  (cost=0.32..151.82 rows=2540 width=36)
                     Sort Key: items1.id
                     ->  Index Scan using items1_pkey on items1  (cost=0.15..63.20 rows=1270 width=36)
                     ->  Index Scan using items2_pkey on items2  (cost=0.15..63.20 rows=1270 width=36)
               ->  Sort  (cost=325.88..336.08 rows=4080 width=12)
                     Sort Key: pairs1.ai
                     ->  Append  (cost=0.00..81.20 rows=4080 width=12)
                           ->  Seq Scan on pairs1  (cost=0.00..30.40 rows=2040 width=12)
                           ->  Seq Scan on pairs2  (cost=0.00..30.40 rows=2040 width=12)
(19 rows)
